system.biography:
TitleFFF 506-3 Feudal Knight MH
Birthday19 Kelen 686
AppearanceAge 33, height 5â 10â, medium frame, weight 160 lb, attractive appearance, fair complexion, black hair, hazel eyes
Medical/PsycheAmorvrus (first life)
Size6
ArmorCloth tunic, leggings and hood. Leather shoes and gloves; mail hauberk, cowl, and leggings; plate knee cops and half-helm. Cloth surcoat and mantle. Kite shield, dagger, broadsword, ball & chain.
Other EquipmentBelt pouch
Valuables103d in silver in a money pouch
NotesSir Cade does not need to sleep, eat, or breath. He does normally try to avoid travelling under full sunlight conditions. In combat, Sir Cade does not tire, and can be very patient waiting for his opponent to tire before coming in for the kill. Sir Cade was given a warhorse to use on his quest; the horse has succumbed to the Shadow of Bukrai and become a gulmorvrus in his service. Sacrifice Ritual 6/50; Bukrai Points: 40

Biography

Sir Morhgan came to Golotha as an impoverished knight bachelor hoping to join one of the Agrikan fighting orders. Instead, he was employed as a bodyguard to a Morgathian priest. At first, it was just a job; the temple fed him, clothed him, gave him armour and weapons, but as the years went by, he slowly converted to the worship of Morgath. He found the act of human sacrifice to be very satisfying to some black corner of his soul.

On the eve of his thirteenth year of service to the temple, he was invited to a special ceremony. It was only when the priests seized him that he realize that he was to be the sacrifice. With a Bukrai blade piercing his belly and his life draining away, the priests offered him Myrvriaâs Kiss, Morhgan accepted.

At first he was angry, but the lure of the shadow, and the power of being undead soon overcame his remaining humanity. On the first of his thirteen âlivesâ, Sir Morhgan still passes as human, though there are clues to his true nature. His voice is raspy and dry, his breath smells of his rotting innards, and his fingernails are yellowed and cracked from building his resting place deep within the old Morgathian temple.

Soon after his transformation, the Khidarmur (High Priest) sent him on a mission. In 719, the temple had secretly sent an artefact to the East. It was meant for a hidden temple, but the caravan transporting it disappeared somewhere on the Salt Route. Sir Morhgan is to recover the artefact and take it to the temple himself.

Adventure Hooks

A Trail of Death: The PCs are travelling and everywhere they pass through or stop has had a recent death or mysterious disappearance, especially of young women. Sir Morhgan is feeding his dark master, but is a bit sloppy with the remains.

Weâre Too Late: PCs are searching for a group of bandits along the Salt Route; they find the entire group freshly dead, with the tracks of a single horse leading away. As they investigate, some of the dead rise as gulmorvrin.

A Scream in the Night: One of Sir Morhganâs sacrifices to Klyss was able to scream as her soul was destroyed. PCs investigating find an armed and armoured knight standing over the body of a young girl, a cold wind blows, carrying the stench of the grave.

Hunted: Sir Morhgan believes that the PCs have information that might lead him to the artefact. Right or wrong, he is hunting them.

Credits

Robin Crossby.
